intro: Chamaefistula standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in arid regions.
